summary:
Cultural Experience Consultant 

I advise individuals, organizations, and companies on how to create and promote cultural experiences surrounding a specific content and for a specific audience. I help clients design immersive themed experiences, creating a story-line that is dramaturgically sound, and that is also culturally and historically minded. 

For that I work closely both to scientists, historians and specialists, and to the creative teams, to produce authentic and engaging experiences that educate and inspire. With an architect background, I work for the last twenty years in the fields of theatre, cultural production and the visual arts, both in Amsterdam and abroad. In my advisory work, I research, consult with experts, compare and find solutions for creative teams to navigate the fine line between fantasy and scientific accuracy. I advise my clients and their teams on architecture, props, copywriting, tone of voice, and I can work directly with actors, grime and costume experts, film makers, graphic designers and prop builders. 

I have a passion for knowledge, craftmanship and hospitality, and my motto is “never underestimate the audience”. My goal is to help clients creating meaningful and impactful experiences, delivering value to the audience and generating positive outcomes for the client.

My most challenging and rewarding project to date was Quake Lisbon, an Immersive Historical experience about the Great Lisbon Earthquake of 1755. Opened in April 2022, it just won three important prizes: an Outstanding Achievement Thea Award - Historical Experience (AOA), 1st prize for Themed Environment at the Blooloop Innovation Awards and at the same event, the 3rd place in the category Innovative Storytelling.

profile_positions.description:
As an independent creative producer I have been working in projects involving international collaborations in the fields of visual arts, performance and theatre. My position as a producer always involves some sort of participation in the artistic process, otherwise I find it not challenging enough. My work starts by participating in the conceptual definition of the project, goes through fund raising and subsidies application, and finishes into full-on production. I'm often part of the project itself, as a performer, a co-writer or a model. Reporting and finance are also of my responsibility.

Some examples:
Behind the Wall - international collaboration between visual artists Mijntje Strenghold (NL) and Roney George (BR). Exhibitions in Amsterdam (April 2015) and in Salvador, at the Museum of Modern Art of Bahia (January/February 2016). Project supported by the AFK, amongst others.
Link for a review (in Portuguese): https://www.revistamuseu.com.br/site/br/noticias/nacionais/65-mam-atelier-estreia-com-projeto-behind-the-wall.html

The Author's Room - script development and installation in historical building in Amsterdam. Film maker Roberta Marques developed a treatment for 6 weeks between December 2018 and January 2019, having regular shows to small audiences of the work in progress, opening her author's room, her actual physical working place to accommodate the visitors. A final reading of the text, with the working title of "Trade",  was shown in January 2019. 

Afterimage - video and sound installation by light designer, Minna Tiikkainen, video maker Helle Lyshøj and visual / video / sound artist Susanna Brenner. Project developed in artists in residencies in Germany and in Belgium, with its grand public show happening in the summer of 2018, at the Stadschouwburg in Amsterdam, during the international dance festival Juli Dans.
Link for a review (in Dutch): https://www.theaterkrant.nl/recensie/afterimage-i-ii-iii/susanna-brenner-helle-lyshoj-minna-tiikkainen/

profile_positions.description:
My collaboration with Petra Ardai dates back to our first meeting at Das Arts school in Amsterdam, in 2003. Petra has a body of work of fine intelligence, often visionary and of a breathtaking beauty. Our story is one of true friendship, so even when I'm not actively participating in one of her projects, I'm always on the background, listening, looking, engaging in some way, and looking forward to join in at any moment. 

Here some of the projects:
SOS – EARTH 99% Resilient, a theatre play about earthling refugees.  @ Parade Den Haag, Parade Rotterdam, Over Het Ij Festival, Parade Utrecht and Parade Amsterdam.
May – Oct. 2017 (Assistant director, props design and execution, costume design, performance @ Parade Utrecht)

Love Me Tinder @ PARADE 2016 a theatre interactive play about intimacy and social media, Aug.2016
[Utrecht and Amsterdam, NL] (Production, PR and Social Media)

Private Terschelling @ OEROL 2016 a living heritage app / guided tour that revisits the past, present and future of Terschelling in relation to the Big Fire of 1666. Jun.2016 [Terschelling, NL] (Production, Performance, Social Media).

Remember Amsterdam – Crash Course Refugee. Presented at de buurtcentrum de Meevaart and at the Tolhuistuin. April 2016 [Amsterdam, NL] (Production, Performance, Social Media).

Private Rotterdam / Katendrecht @ the AFFR (Architecture Film Festival of Rotterdam - http://affr.nl), a theatrical app / guided tour, Oct. 2015 [Rotterdam, NL] (Production and Performance).

STATS – your daily portion of truth, a theatrical installation in the public space with live-fed, edited statistic data. Site specific performance during Food Festival @ Indische Buurt, Sept. 2015 [Amsterdam, NL]. (Production and Performance)

The Cloud – eagerly waiting for your arrival, a guided tour in the wax museum of the future. Site specific performance and workshop during De Grote Geheugen Show, a Studium Generale . Feb. 2015. [Arnhem, NL] (Performance)
